description: From French éroder, from Latin ērōdō.

verbs.description: erode (third-person singular simple present erodes, present participle eroding, simple past and past participle eroded)

entries.meaning: To wear away by abrasion, corrosion or chemical reaction.
examples: The cliff is gradually being eroded by the waves.

entries.meaning: (figurative) To destroy gradually by an ongoing process.
